meaning: Green fruit.

Vehicle with 4 wheels.
Barking animal.
Pull something hard or suddenly.
An attractively arranged bunch of flowers.
Area of short, mown grass in a yard, garden or park.
(Of grass or a crop) cut down with a machine.
Hold close in one's arms as a way of showing love or affection.
Touch or stroke gently or lovingly.
Cause (someone or something) to change course or turn from one direction to another.
A bird of the order galliformes that is kept for its eggs and flesh; a rooster or hen.
Domestic fowl, such as chickens, turkeys, ducks, and geese.
The action of forging or producing a copy of a document, signature or work of art.
A witty remark.
Remove (a substance) from the surface of a liquid.
Any of the main wing or tail feathers of a bird.
Move with a smooth continuous motion, typically with little noise.
Having or showing skill in achieving one's ends by deceit or evasion.
Skill in performing tasks, especially with the hands.
The use of dexterity or cunning, especially so as to deceive.
Attractively unusual or old-fashioned.
A large hole in the ground.
A place, typically a large, deep pit, from which stone or other materials are extracted.
A person, especially a child, who is mischievous in a likable or amusing way.
A person who claims or is believed to have magic powers; a wizard.
Leave (someone) without the means to move from somewhere.
Unwilling to give or spend; ungenerous.
A piece of coarse material placed on a floor for people to wipe their feet on.
A tool used for cutting crops such as grass or wheat, with a long curved blade at the end of a long pole.
A cultivated plant that is grown as food, especially a grain, fruit or vegetable.
Made in exact imitation of something valuable or important with the intention to deceive or defraud.
A piece of old cloth, especially one torn from a larger piece, used typically for cleaning things.
One of two long metal and rubber parts that move against a windscreen to remove rain.
Money, goods, or other benefit to which one is entitled as an employee or as a shareholder of a company.
An underground conduit for carrying off drainage water and waste matter.
Make small movements, especially of the hands and feet, through nervousness or impatience.
(Of a knife, pencil, etc.) having a worn-down edge or point; not sharp.
(Of an object) having an edge or point that is able to cut or pierce something.
An opening of restricted size allowing for passage from one area to another.
(of an egg) open and produce a young animal.
Not firmly or tightly fixed in place; detached or able to be detached.

Particularly good, skillful, or effective.
The owner and manager of a shop.
Intended to provoke someone in an insulting or contemptuous manner.
Revealing, indicating, or betraying something.
An informer.
A large farm building used for storing grain, hay, or straw or for housing livestock.
Farm animals regarded as an asset.
A load, typically a heavy one.
Large ruminant animals with horns and cloven hoofs, domesticated for meat or milk, or as beasts of burden; cows.
A movable joint or mechanism on which a door, gate, or lid swings as it opens and closes or which connects linked objects.
A hinged flap at the back of a truck that can be lowered or removed when loading or unloading the vehicle.
A small, decorative piece of plastic, metal, or wood that a woman or girl wears in her hair, often to stop it falling in front of her face.
Reduction in the number or quantity of something.
A contract by which one party conveys land, property, services, etc. to another for a specified time, usually in return for a periodic payment.
